column1: Photosynthesis is the process used by plants, algae and certain bacteria to harness energy from sunlight and turn it into chemical energy.
The Eiffel Tower is a wrought iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France.
Quantum mechanics is a fundamental theory in physics that describes the physical properties of nature at small scales.
Artificial intelligence is intelligence demonstrated by machines, in contrast to the natural intelligence displayed by humans and animals.
The human circulatory system, also known as the cardiovascular system, is a vast network that transports blood to all parts of the body.
Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its simplicity and readability.
The Great Barrier Reef is the world's largest coral reef system located in the Coral Sea, off the coast of Queensland, Australia.
Mozart was a prolific and influential composer of the Classical era who composed over 600 works.
The Milky Way is the galaxy that includes our Solar System, with the name describing the galaxy's appearance from Earth.
The concept of zero, both as a placeholder and as a symbol for nothing, is a relatively recent development in human history.
